bill_title: to revise the responsibilities of counties providing for prisoner care and the liability of prisoners for reimbursing the county for costs incurred.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the responsibilities of counties providing for prisoner care and the liability of prisoners for reimbursing the county for costs incurred. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 24-11-21 be amended to read as follows: 24-11-21. The governing body or board of county commissioners is responsible for securing bedclothing, laundry, board, nursing when required, and shall provide all necessaries for the comfort and welfare of the prisoners including room and board, bedclothing, and laundry and medical, dental, optometric, nursing, and psychiatric services . If a prisoner or any person under arrest receives medical treatment pursuant to this section for which the governing board or board of county commissioners is liable, the receipt of such medical treatment shall, as to the person receiving such treatment, operate as an assignment by operation of law of any rights to medical support, insurance proceeds, or both, that the prisoner or person under arrest may have for himself such person . Any rights or amounts so assigned shall be applied against the cost of medical care paid under this section. Any payments made under this section for medical care not recovered shall constitute a lien pursuant to § 28-14-1. Section 2. That § 24-11-45 be amended to read as follows: 24-11-45. A prisoner confined to any jail while serving a sentence is liable for the cost of the prisoner's confinement including room and board charges ; and medical, dental, optometric, and psychiatric services charges ; vocational education training; and chemical dependency treatment charges. If, after considering the prisoner's net income, net worth, number of dependents, and any existing obligations, the . The judge who sentenced the prisoner to jail determines that the prisoner is unable to pay, the judge may after considering the prisoner's net income, net worth, number of dependents, and existing obligations waive all or part of the payment for the costs of the inmate's confinement. Any confinement costs not recovered constitute a lien pursuant to § 28-14-1.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the responsibilities of counties providing for prisoner care and the liability of prisoners for reimbursing the county for costs incurred. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 24-11-21 be amended to read as follows: 24-11-21. The governing body or board of county commissioners is responsible for securing bedclothing, laundry, board, nursing when required, and shall provide all necessaries for the comfort and welfare of the prisoners including room and board, bedclothing, and laundry and medical, dental, optometric, nursing, and psychiatric services . If a prisoner or any person under arrest receives medical treatment pursuant to this section for which the governing board or board of county commissioners is liable, the receipt of such medical treatment shall, as to the person receiving such treatment, operate as an assignment by operation of law of any rights to medical support, insurance proceeds, or both, that the prisoner or person under arrest may have for himself such person . Any rights or amounts so assigned shall be applied against the cost of medical care paid under this section. Any payments made under this section for medical care not recovered shall constitute a lien pursuant to § 28-14-1. Section 2. That § 24-11-45 be amended to read as follows: 24-11-45. A prisoner confined to any jail while serving a sentence who is ultimately convicted of the crime for which confined is liable for the cost of the prisoner's pretrial and postconviction confinement including room and board charges ; and medical, dental, optometric, and psychiatric services charges ; vocational education training; and chemical dependency treatment charges. If, after considering the prisoner's net income, net worth, number of dependents, and any existing obligations, the . The judge who sentenced the prisoner to jail determines that the prisoner is unable to pay, the judge may after considering the prisoner's net income, net worth, number of dependents, and existing obligations waive all or part of the payment for the costs of the inmate's confinement. Any confinement costs not recovered or waived constitutes a lien pursuant to § 28-14-1. BILL HISTORY 1/28/97 First read in Senate and referred to Judiciary. S.J. 192 2/5/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/5/97 Judiciary Do Pass Amended, AYES 7, NAYS 0. S.J. 339
